doc.title: EMBOSS

description.text: European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite

doc.reference: EMBOSS: The European Molecular Biology Open Software Suite (2000) Rice,P. Longden,I. and Bleasby, A. Trends in Genetics 16, (6) pp276--277

fieldset.title: This parameter is mandatory
fieldset.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

xhtml:div.label:
Nucleic acid sequence alignment mode?
Simple Translation Mixed alignments
Nucleic acid sequence alignment mode (simple, translated or mixed)
Also consider the reverse complement Yes No

Use overlap weights?
Default (when nseq =< 35) Yes No
By default overlap weights are used when Nseq =<35 but you can set this to 'yes' or 'no'

Clustering method to construct sequence tree?
Upgma Maximum linkage Minimum linkage
Clustering method to construct sequence tree (UPGMA, minimum linkage or maximum linkage)
Maximum fragment length (value greater than or equal to 0)
Consider only n-fragment pairs that start with two matches Yes No
Consider only p-fragment pairs if first amino acid or codon pair has similarity score of at least n (value greater than or equal to 0)
Use iterative score Yes No
Threshold for considering diagonal for alignment (value greater than or equal to 0.0)
Replace unaligned characters by stars '*' rather then putting them in lowercase Yes No
Activate writing of stars instead of numbers Yes No
Put up to n stars '*' instead of digits 0-9 to indicate level of conservation (value greater than or equal to 0)
Name of the output file (e_outfile)
Name of the output sequence file (e_outseq)

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Nucleic acid sequence alignment mode (simple, translated or mixed)
By default overlap weights are used when Nseq =<35 but you can set this to 'yes' or 'no'
Clustering method to construct sequence tree (UPGMA, minimum linkage or maximum linkage)

div.title: This parameter is mandatory
div.data-formats: EMBL FASTA GCG GENBANK NBRF CODATA RAW SWISSPROT GFF

format.code: ("", " -nucmode=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

comment.text: Nucleic acid sequence alignment mode (simple, translated or mixed)

interface.label:
Nucleic acid sequence alignment mode?
Simple Translation Mixed alignments
Nucleic acid sequence alignment mode (simple, translated or mixed)

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Nucleic acid sequence alignment mode (simple, translated or mixed)

interface.label: Also consider the reverse complement Yes No

format.code: ("", " -overlapw=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

comment.text: By default overlap weights are used when Nseq =<35 but you can set this to 'yes' or 'no'

interface.label:
Use overlap weights?
Default (when nseq =< 35) Yes No
By default overlap weights are used when Nseq =<35 but you can set this to 'yes' or 'no'

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: By default overlap weights are used when Nseq =<35 but you can set this to 'yes' or 'no'

parameter.name: e_linkage
parameter.prompt: Clustering method to construct sequence tree

format.code: ("", " -linkage=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

comment.text: Clustering method to construct sequence tree (UPGMA, minimum linkage or maximum linkage)

interface.label:
Clustering method to construct sequence tree?
Upgma Maximum linkage Minimum linkage
Clustering method to construct sequence tree (UPGMA, minimum linkage or maximum linkage)

xhtml:div.xhtml:div: Clustering method to construct sequence tree (UPGMA, minimum linkage or maximum linkage)

parameter.name: e_maxfragl
parameter.prompt: Maximum fragment length (value greater than or equal to 0)

format.code: ("", " -maxfragl=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

message.text: Value greater than or equal to 0 is required

interface.label: Maximum fragment length (value greater than or equal to 0)

parameter.name: e_fragmat
parameter.prompt: Consider only n-fragment pairs that start with two matches

interface.label: Consider only n-fragment pairs that start with two matches Yes No

parameter.name: e_fragsim
parameter.prompt: Consider only p-fragment pairs if first amino acid or codon pair has similarity score of at least n (value greater than or equal to 0)

format.code: ("", " -fragsim=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

message.text: Value greater than or equal to 0 is required

interface.label: Consider only p-fragment pairs if first amino acid or codon pair has similarity score of at least n (value greater than or equal to 0)

parameter.name: e_threshold
parameter.prompt: Threshold for considering diagonal for alignment (value greater than or equal to 0.0)

format.code: ("", " -threshold=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

message.text: Value greater than or equal to 0.0 is required

interface.label: Threshold for considering diagonal for alignment (value greater than or equal to 0.0)

parameter.name: e_mask
parameter.prompt: Replace unaligned characters by stars '*' rather then putting them in lowercase

interface.label: Replace unaligned characters by stars '*' rather then putting them in lowercase Yes No

parameter.name: e_dostars
parameter.prompt: Activate writing of stars instead of numbers

interface.label: Activate writing of stars instead of numbers Yes No

parameter.name: e_starnum
parameter.prompt: Put up to n stars '*' instead of digits 0-9 to indicate level of conservation (value greater than or equal to 0)

format.code: ("", " -starnum=" + str(value))[value is not None and value!=vdef]

message.text: Value greater than or equal to 0 is required

interface.label: Put up to n stars '*' instead of digits 0-9 to indicate level of conservation (value greater than or equal to 0)

parameter.name: e_outseq
parameter.prompt: Name of the output sequence file (e_outseq)

interface.label: Name of the output sequence file (e_outseq)
